summary: This is a January 4, 2019, internal update from the Public Corruption Unit, likely within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). It outlines the significant developments in the newly opened investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on allegations of sexual abuse of minors transported to/from New York, the problematic 2008 Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), and initial investigative steps including victim identification and coordination with Florida authorities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation for allegedly sexually abusing dozens of minors over more than a decade, and the beneficiary of a 2008 Non-Prosecution Agreement from Florida.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Attorney, along with Pete Skinner, representing certain victims; recently met with the prosecutors from the Public Corruption Unit.

persons.name: Pete Skinner
persons.context: Attorney, along with David Boies, representing certain victims; recently met with the prosecutors from the Public Corruption Unit.

connections.description: The document states the Florida NPA immunized Epstein and a number of his alleged co-conspirators, including a New York-based 'booker' responsible for scheduling massages with underage girls.
Both are identified as counsel representing certain victims in the Epstein case, having met together with prosecutors.
Boies is counsel for victims who are making allegations against Epstein.
Skinner is counsel for victims who are making allegations against Epstein.

events.title: Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA)
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein resolved a pending federal investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida with a Non-Prosecution Agreement. It immunized Epstein and alleged co-conspirators from federal prosecution in that district.

events.title: SDNY Public Corruption Unit Case Update
events.description: The unit provides an internal update on the significant developments in the newly opened investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, outlining allegations, the problematic Florida NPA, and initial investigative steps.

events.title: Meeting with Victims' Counsel
events.description: Prosecutors from the Public Corruption Unit recently met with attorneys David Boies and Pete Skinner, who represent certain victims.

keyFacts: The SDNY Public Corruption Unit, with the FBI, is actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein for allegations of sexually abusing dozens of minors over more than a decade, including those transported to/from New York.

The investigation is examining the 2008 Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), which the document notes was 'by its terms binding only that office' but 'purported to immunize not only Epstein, but a number of his alleged co-conspirators,' including a New York-based 'booker.'
Investigators are identifying New York-based victims, reviewing documents from the original Florida investigation, and planning to look into post-NPA misconduct allegations.
The SDNY has informed the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida of its investigation; that office 'appreciated the heads up and indicated that they must be recused from it.'
The document references a meeting with high-profile victims' attorneys David Boies and Pete Skinner, indicating early engagement with victim representatives.
